text:
1 Introduction 
 
Drive Technology Commissioner 
Entry ID: 109807261,    V19.1,    03/2024 
  
4 
 
© Siemens AG 2024 All rights reserved 
1 
Introduction 
1.1 
Overview 
Drive Technology Commissioner lets you modify parameters and/or tags of 
technology objects and drives, either offline in the engineering system project or 
online in the drive. 
Using Drive Technology Commissioner allows you to plan more efficient 
commissioning and engineering times, shortening these timelines in the process. 
In projects where the same drives and technology objects (or similar ones) are 
present, it is possible to modify multiple parameters and/or tags of the objects. In 
this way, default values that must be used for multiple drives or technology objects 
can be quickly applied to the parameterization and do not need to be manually 
adjusted for each individual object.  
 
Figure 1-1 Drive Technology Commissioner 
 
 
1.2 
Principle of operation 
Drive Technology Commissioner is a standalone application. It uses the Openness 
API from TIA Portal to access the parameters and tags in the project or online on 
the drive. 
Drive Technology Commissioner has a user interface that allows use of its 
functions without any additional knowledge of TIA Openness or the API.  
Additional to drives and technology objects in TIA Portal, Drive Technology 
Commissioner also supports editing of drive parameters and technology tags, 
provided you use one of the following engineering platforms:  
• 
STARTER 
• 
SIMOTION SCOUT/ SCOUT TIA 
• 
SINUMERIK Archives
text_summary: Drive Technology Commissioner is a standalone application that allows users to modify parameters and tags of technology objects and drives, either offline in the engineering system project or online in the drive. It uses the Openness API from TIA Portal to access the parameters and tags, and provides a user-friendly interface to use its functions without requiring additional knowledge of TIA Openness or the API.

text:
2 Installation and setup 
 
Drive Technology Commissioner 
Entry ID: 109807261,    V19.1,    03/2024 
  
7 
 
© Siemens AG 2024 All rights reserved 
2 
Installation and setup 
 
2.1 
Preparation 
Set up Windows user groups 
Before Drive Technology Commissioner can be used, the Windows user who will 
be working with Drive Technology Commissioner must be added to the "Siemens 
TIA Openness" user group. 
The Table below describes how to add a user to a user group. 
 
Table 2-1 Adding Windows users to user groups 
No. 
Action 
1.  
Open Computer Management by right-clicking on "This PC" in Windows Explorer 
and then selecting "Manage" from the menu.  
 
2.  
Open "Local Users and Groups" -> "Users" and double-click the user who will be 
working with Drive Technology Commissioner.
text_summary: "Installation and setup of Drive Technology Commissioner, including preparation steps such as adding a Windows user to the 'Siemens TIA Openness' group."

No. 
Action 
3.  
Go to the "Member of" tab and click "Add". 
 
4.  
Add "Siemens TIA Openness" and confirm with "OK". 
 
5.  
Log out of Windows and then log back in to apply the new user group 
assignment.
text_summary: "Installation and setup instructions for Siemens AG, including adding a user group and logging back in to apply changes."

text:
2 Installation and setup 
 
Drive Technology Commissioner 
Entry ID: 109807261,    V19.1,    03/2024 
  
9 
 
© Siemens AG 2024 All rights reserved 
2.2 
Installation 
2.2.1 
Extract folder and run program for the first time 
No installation is necessary in order to use Drive Technology Commissioner. 
Download the file "109779879_DriveTechnologyCommissioner_PROG_V1.0.zip" 
from the Siemens Industry Support article and extract it. 
In the folder containing the extracted files, run the file "DT_Com.exe" to launch 
Drive Technology Commissioner.  
 
Figure 2-1 Drive Technology Commissioner folder contents
text_summary: Installation and setup of Drive Technology Commissioner requires extracting a downloaded zip file and running the "DT_Com.exe" file to launch the program, no installation is necessary.

2.2.2 
Acknowledgements when running the application for the first time 
When the application is first launched, you will need to confirm some messages in 
order to complete the setup. The Table below describes the steps to follow when 
running the application for the first time.  
  
Table 2-2 Initial launch of the application 
No. 
Action 
1.  
Launch Drive Technology Commissioner by running the file "DTCom.exe". 
2.  
Read the disclaimer and acknowledge it by ticking the box by "I have read and 
accept the terms and conditions".
